item.title: Breaking Laces - BLTV - "GOGO Brings Bulldog Back"
item.description: He's bringing Bulldog Back! Those other Ruppies don't know how to act! Sexy Back is copyright Justin Timberlake. No copyright infringement is intended. Breaking Laces does NOT own this song. It has only been covered for puppy entertainment!
item.dc:creator: Breaking Laces Officially Awesome Podcast & BLTV

Sexy Back is copyright Justin Timberlake. No copyright infringement is intended. Breaking Laces does NOT own this song. It has only been covered for puppy entertainment!

item.title: Breaking Laces - How To Add Skateboard Trucks To Your Bass Amp
item.description: Breaking Laces - This episode is dedicated to all you bass players out there with those Ampeg 8x10 bass amps. You know how difficult it is to find the right caster wheels, and Rob has found the solution to your woes...
item.dc:creator: Breaking Laces Officially Awesome Podcast & BLTV
item.itunes:summary: Breaking Laces - This episode is dedicated to all you bass players out there with those Ampeg 8x10 bass amps. You know how difficult it is to find the right caster wheels, and Rob has found the solution to your woes...

item.title: Breaking Laces Tour Chronicles #3 - The Boys Hit The Road
item.description: Join the guys of Breaking Laces as they give you a true insight into life on the road where there is never a dull moment. In this episode, the band teaches the audience the art of preparing for a show while on the road. We watch as the guys tend to their instruments in the van and then conduct a hotel room rehearsal where the viewer gets to watch as Breaking Laces conducts an immensely intimate set. After their show bassist Rob decides it is in this best interest to get tazered. Following their preparation (and tazings) the band drops in at at television network affiliate to talk their new album. Now in it’s second season Breaking Laces Television strives to keep you entertained and up to date on the happenings of your favorite three piece band out of Brooklyn, NY. Season 2 will see the return of Marty McDee: Full time musician/part-time employee, an unlikely rap video with BL buddy MC Dashah as well as lead singer Willem’s first ever Flash movie. Also in an effort to fill a hole left by last season, the boys will be taking Flip cameras out on their tour to bring you back an inside look at their lives on the road. www.breakinglaces.com

item.title: Breaking Laces Tour Chronicles #2 - The Boys Hit The Road
item.description: Join the guys of Breaking Laces as they give you a true insight into life on the road where there is never a dull moment. In this episode, the boys pack the van and begin their tour journey. While traveling with the band, the audience is presented with the ancient debate of Connecticut vs New Jersey. During a break from driving Willem demonstrates the proper way to brush your teeth on the road. The guys wrap up this episode with a live performance of "When You Find Out" where we are introduced to the unknown fourth member of the band. Now in it’s second season Breaking Laces Television strives to keep you entertained and up to date on the happenings of your favorite three piece band out of Brooklyn, NY. Season 2 will see the return of Marty McDee: Full time musician/part-time employee, an unlikely rap video with BL buddy MC Dashah as well as lead singer Willem’s first ever Flash movie. Also in an effort to fill a hole left by last season, the boys will be taking Flip cameras out on their tour to bring you back an inside look at their lives on the road. www.breakinglaces.com

item.title: Breaking Laces Tour Chronicles #1 - Album Release Party NYC
item.description: Join the guys of Breaking Laces as they give you a true insight into life on the road where there is never a dull moment. In this episode, lead singer Willem speaks about their album release performance, SXSW, the fans and the apocalypse. Viewers also get to watch as Breaking Laces play to a sold out New York crowd at the release party for their latest album "When You Find Out". Now in it’s second season Breaking Laces Television strives to keep you entertained and up to date on the happenings of your favorite three piece band out of Brooklyn, NY. Season 2 will see the return of Marty McDee: Full time musician/part-time employee, an unlikely rap video with BL buddy MC Dashah as well as lead singer Willem’s first ever Flash movie. Also in an effort to fill a hole left by last season, the boys will be taking Flip cameras out on their tour to bring you back an inside look at their lives on the road. www.breakinglaces.com

item.title: The Dirty Birdy EP
item.description: We recorded quite a catalog in recent years. Listen this unreleased EP recorded in 2007... features "Donkey Punch Gone Wrong" and other tunes (Note... as the name suggests, the other song titles are a little too Dirty Birdy for Facebook, so if you are old enough... tune in online)! The Breaking Laces Officially Awesome Podcast series will bring you inside the band's circle. You will hear their creative storytelling about life, music and robots. In a few short years, the Brooklyn trio known as Breaking Laces has quietly built a potent body of recorded work and carved out a formidable reputation as a powerful live act. In the process, they've amassed a large and fiercely devoted grass-roots fan base that's been solidified by the group's tireless roadwork. These achievements are all the more impressive in light of the fact that they've been accomplished on the band's own terms, with an absence of outside hype and an old-school emphasis on honest musicianship and irresistibly melodic, emotionally engaging songwriting. www.breakinglaces.com

item.title: Tour Prep
item.description: What was supposed to be "Spinal Chicken" turns into a video log. With the boys now on the road for a month stretch, take a quick look at how Willem packs and preps for tour. Now in it’s second season Breaking Laces Television strives to keep you entertained and up to date on the happenings of your favorite three piece band out of Brooklyn, NY. Season 2 will see the return of Marty McDee: Full time musician/part-time employee, an unlikely rap video with BL buddy MC Dashah as well as lead singer Willem’s first ever Flash movie. Also in an effort to fill a hole left by last season, the boys will be taking Flip cameras out on their upcoming May and June tour to bring you back an inside look at their lives on the road. Stay tuned.

item.title: Live for the Suits 2006
item.description: From Nashville to NYC, we recorded quite a catalog in recent years. Listen to four live songs from NYC in 2006. Includes "Shack Up SOS" and "Call You Home" from the album Lemonade. Also included "Megan" and "Geek in Love" from the album Sohcahtoa. The Breaking Laces Officially Awesome Podcast series will bring you inside the band's circle. You will hear their creative storytelling about life, music and robots. In a few short years, the Brooklyn trio known as Breaking Laces has quietly built a potent body of recorded work and carved out a formidable reputation as a powerful live act. In the process, they've amassed a large and fiercely devoted grass-roots fan base that's been solidified by the group's tireless roadwork. These achievements are all the more impressive in light of the fact that they've been accomplished on the band's own terms, with an absence of outside hype and an old-school emphasis on honest musicianship and irresistibly melodic, emotionally engaging songwriting. www.breakinglaces.com

item.title: Punch 'em in the Ballz
item.description: Newcomer Chris Mannix and long time friend MC Dashah join the fellows for a music video shot on the streets of Brooklyn. "Everything is fair in love and bar scrapping, you ain't looking below but boy you know it's happening." Indeed it is. Now in it’s second season Breaking Laces Television strives to keep you entertained and up to date on the happenings of your favorite three piece band out of Brooklyn, NY. Season 2 will see the return of Marty McDee: Full time musician/part-time employee, an unlikely rap video with BL buddy MC Dashah as well as lead singer Willem’s first ever Flash movie. Also in an effort to fill a hole left by last season, the boys will be taking Flip cameras out on their upcoming May and June tour to bring you back an inside look at their lives on the road. Stay tuned.

item.title: Band Camp Vermont
item.description: Welcome to Breaking Laces Band Camp. Every year or so we try to take four to five dormant days on our calendar to concentrate on new material and new ideas. For our very first Band Camp we went to the mountains of Vermont to focus on music, songwriting, horseback riding and a little poker too! In this episode of the Breaking Laces Officially Awesome Podcast, we share a few songs from this experience - "In My Mind," "Languishing in Love," "Sing Myself to Sleep," and "This World." The Breaking Laces Officially Awesome Podcast series will bring you inside the band's circle. You will hear their creative storytelling about life, music and robots. In a few short years, the Brooklyn trio known as Breaking Laces has quietly built a potent body of recorded work and carved out a formidable reputation as a powerful live act. In the process, they've amassed a large and fiercely devoted grass-roots fan base that's been solidified by the group's tireless roadwork. These achievements are all the more impressive in light of the fact that they've been accomplished on the band's own terms, with an absence of outside hype and an old-school emphasis on honest musicianship and irresistibly melodic, emotionally engaging songwriting. www.breakinglaces.com

item.title: Untying the Laces
item.description: BLTV, the official online TV station of Breaking Laces, kick starts Season 2 with a Dateline Special: Untying the Laces. Reporter Paul Peterson visits with the band to try and get to the bottom of what happened at the SXSW festival in Austin, TX which led to drummer Seth Masarsky breaking both his wrists. Ripe with riveting interviews and outrageous dramatic reenactments, this episode is not to be missed. Now in it’s second season Breaking Laces Television strives to keep you entertained and up to date on the happenings of your favorite three piece band out of Brooklyn, NY. Season 2 will see the return of Marty McDee: Full time musician/part-time employee, an unlikely rap video with BL buddy MC Dashah as well as lead singer Willem’s first ever Flash movie. Also in an effort to fill a hole left by last season, the boys will be taking Flip cameras out on their upcoming May and June tour to bring you back an inside look at their lives on the road. Stay tuned.

item.title: Undercover Cool
item.description: From Nashville to NYC, we recorded quite a catalog over the last two years. Listen to four songs we reluctantly left on the floor from the Nashville portion when piecing together our new album “When You Find Out” set to be released May 19th, 2011. The Breaking Laces Officially Awesome Podcast series will bring you inside the band's circle. You will hear their creative storytelling about life, music and robots. In a few short years, the Brooklyn trio known as Breaking Laces has quietly built a potent body of recorded work and carved out a formidable reputation as a powerful live act. In the process, they've amassed a large and fiercely devoted grass-roots fan base that's been solidified by the group's tireless roadwork. These achievements are all the more impressive in light of the fact that they've been accomplished on the band's own terms, with an absence of outside hype and an old-school emphasis on honest musicianship and irresistibly melodic, emotionally engaging songwriting. www.breakinglaces.com
